title: posting Fatal errors often.
content: I’ve been getting the following messages when posting. But hit ‘back’ twice it will show the message has been sent.. any idea when or why it will be fixed? ` Fatal error: Can't open file: 'watchdog.MYD'. (errno: 145) query: INSERT INTO watchdog (uid, type, message, severity, link, location, hostname, timestamp) VALUES (7029, 'php', 'Can't open file: 'watchdog.MYD'. (errno: 145)\nquery: INSERT INTO watchdog (uid, type, message, severity, link, location, hostname, timestamp) VALUES (7029, 'content', 'Comment: added who ate all the pies? what.', 0, 'view', '/comment/reply/18821', '82.69.26.244', 1143547292) in /home/httpd/vhosts/typophile.com/httpdocs/cms/includes/database.mysql.inc on line 66.', 2, '', '/comment/reply/18821', '82.69.26.244', 1143547292) in /home/httpd/vhosts/typophile.com/httpdocs/cms/includes/database.mysql.inc on line 66`
author: vinceconnare

comments.content:
Yesterday during the day I wasn’t able to log in at all. Finally got in last night. Today after a couple tries, I got through. Same fatal error message.

Not a big deal, but for the record I blame Joe, but that is just me.

J.

I think this error is system wide and I’m sure they are working on it.

Vinnie, close your tag.
Despite the “fatal error” message, the comments seem to post ok. You just have to go back and refresh the page to see them.

It can’t be good, that’s for sure. I always wonder if I somehow caused it. If there is a way to break something, I can often stumble across the method. I think I’d make a good beta testor…  
: )
“Permanent fatal error” is even more ominous…

Yes, Being Fatal (dead) is one thing but being fatal(dead) perminently, :-)

ChrisL
Reports of Typophile’s death have been greatly exagerated.

This problem has been reported a little while ago by yours truly to the powers that be — the [Credibility-Defying Christian Code-God](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Christian%20Robertson) — and has been dealt with accordingly. This is not the first time it happens.

Seems to be working fine now.

ChrisL

He is a good Christian :-)

ChrisL
